result.execSummary:
The defendant Antonio Lee Wallace was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 45 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 37 days time served. 

COURT WAIVED all costs due to the Defendant is indigent.

Restitution set at ZERO.

Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form

Defendant Antonio Lee Wallace in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.  Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM THE HOUSE OF CORRECTION FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA AND SENTENCING IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Brian Christopher Hagner in court, Defendant Antonio Lee Wallace not in court, in custody (bull pen).  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/Sentencing Hearing scheduled for October 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Victor's, Vic J., John J., or Roy M.

Defendant Antonio Lee Wallace in court.  David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. Defendant states he does not want counsel. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br. 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
